org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.util

Class ColorScale

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.util.ColorScale
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ColorMap<Double>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GradientScale, MultiGradientScale

    public abstract class ColorScale
extends Object
implements ColorMap<Double>
    The abstract class ColorScale contains shared methods for implementations of the ColorMap interface which map based on position in a range of values.

      • getMaximum

        public double getMaximum()
        getMaximum

        public double getMaximum()

        Gets the highest value for which color scaling is performed.
        Returns:
        Returns the maximum value for color scaling as a double.

      • getMinimum

        public double getMinimum()
        getMinimum

        public double getMinimum()

        Gets the lowest value for which color scaling is performed.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum value for color scaling as a double.

      • getScaledMaximum

        public double getScaledMaximum()
        getScaledMaximum

        public double getScaledMaximum()

        Gets the highest for which color scaling is performed, scaled based on scale type.
        Returns:
        Returns the maximum value for color scaling as a double, if scaling is linear, and the logarithm of this value, if scaling is logarithmic.

      • getScaledMinimum

        public double getScaledMinimum()
        getScaledMinimum

        public double getScaledMinimum()

        Gets the lowest for which color scaling is performed, scaled based on scale type.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum value for color scaling as a double, if scaling is linear, and the logarithm of this value, if scaling is logarithmic.

      • isLinear

        public boolean isLinear()
        isLinear

        public boolean isLinear()

        Indicates whether this color mapping is linear or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this is a linear mapping and false otherwise.

      • isLogarithmic

        public boolean isLogarithmic()
        isLogairthmic

        public boolean isLogairthmic()

        Indicates whether this color mapping is logarithmic or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this is a logarithmic mapping and false if it is not.
